item.title: New Dawn of War 4 story trailer reveals surprise inclusion of Dark Angels sub-faction and everyone's favourite 10,000+ year-old grandpa
item.content:encoded:
A new story trailer for Dawn of War 4 has just been revealed, showing off the Dark Angels as a playable sub-faction, and teasing the old and busted Lion El' Johnson who appears to actually be hanging around his kids for once.

The trailer also gives us some more context as to why the four playable factions are back on Kronus, with Blood Ravens and Orks clashing like the good ol' days, while the Adeptus Mechanicus explore Necron tombs. We see a variety of units new to the series, including a Chaplan on bike, Necron skorpekh destroyers and an Ork Beastboss.

Lion El' Johnson interestingly enough has his helmet on at the tail end of the trailer, which may have prevented some from noticing his presence in the trailer. However, given we see his shield on full display, that's certainly him!

We also now know that the Dawn of War 4 campaign has been written by Black Library author John French. He's written plenty of Warhammer books over the years. This includes books focused on Ahriman, the first captain of the Thousand Suns legion. There's been a long-running fan theory that the Blood Ravens are successors of the Thousand Sons, so who knows? Maybe John French will drop a breadcrumb or two.

Other interesting tidbits from the trailer include the fact warboss Gorgutz is still alive and kicking. This makes sense as the Orks canonically were the victors of Dawn of War: Soulstorm, thus Orks would still be milling about the place. The Necrons have been fleshed out a bit too, ironically.

During the campaign, players will be able to pick between Dark Angels and Blood Ravens missions, allowing a degree of choice depending on which Space Marine faction you vibe with the most. These missions are "non-linear" according to the official press release for this story trailer.

Dawn of War 4 is set to release sometime in 2026, though you can wishlist it now! If you want to get an idea of what it's like, why not read our Dawn of War 4 preview. In it, writer Chris Tapsell stated: "it feels like the sequel to the original that RTS fans always wanted".

Related topics

item.title: 10 Chambers shows off new Den of Wolves gameplay, courtesy of community gameplay trailer
item.content:encoded:
A new Den of Wolves gameplay trailer has been revealed at tonight's PC Gaming Show, showcasing fans of 10 Chambers' previous titles tackling a heist within a giant robot factory in the upcoming co-operative FPS.

The trailer, splicing player reactions and gameplay, showcases a little bit of the pre-heist stealth gameplay, as well as live firefights and mechanical Sentinels wiping out the squad. The trailer ends with a call to wishlist the game, with no release date stated.

On the topic of the release date, communications director Robin Björkell and 10 Chambers co-founder Oscar J-T Holm explained why a release date is yet to be provided

Björkell stated: "I've been begging management to give us a release window for Den of Wolves in the trailer - but no. They won't budge. These developers really don't want to make promises they can't keep for the sake of marketing. It makes my job harder, but as a gamer myself, I respect it. I told them we at least need to prove that the game exists, and that was the starting point for this trailer. We invited some of our most loyal fans to come to our office and play the game. This is real footage of them playing the game - not scripted, not us playing. The game does exist - ask them"

Oscar J-T Holm followed up with: "Even though we've not conducted any closed or public playtests yet, Den of Wolves has over half a million wishlists. We're so grateful for our community's support, and we can't wait to show more details about the game. The reason we're shy about communicating a release window yet is that we learned our lesson with GTFO, which was delayed multiple times. We don't think it's fair to communicate fake dates for the sake of getting an announcement out"

Den of Wolves was first teased in August 2023, and later revealed in December that same year. Even then, any hint at a release date was dispelled with a "ready when it's ready" approach. It seems those looking for a new heist game will have to wait patiently a little longer.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/den-of-wolves-gameplay-trailer-pc-gaming-show
